intro: Epipactis helleborine subsp. leutei, commonly known as the yellow helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its broad, dark green leaves and showy, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. It produces a single spike of flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its yellowish coloration, which sets it apart from other members of the *Epipactis* genus.
